title.value: Neural Active Learning Meets the Partial Monitoring Framework
title.justification: The title is explicitly provided at the beginning of the paper and throughout the document.
title.quote: Neural Active Learning Meets the Partial Monitoring Framework

extractions.description: The paper introduces a novel connection between online active learning (OAL) and the Partial Monitoring (PM) framework, proposing a new method called NeuralCBP. This approach is designed for cost-sensitive OAL tasks and leverages neural networks to account for predictive uncertainty. The study demonstrates that NeuralCBP competes with and often outperforms existing baselines across binary, multi-class, and cost-sensitive OAL tasks.

type.justification: The paper primarily focuses on introducing a novel theoretical framework to connect online active learning with the partial monitoring framework.
type.quote: We propose a novel foundation for OAL tasks based on partial monitoring, a theoretical framework specialized in online learning from partially informative actions.

name.justification: The research specifically targets the field of online active learning, proposing methods to improve this specific domain.
name.quote: We focus on the online-based active learning (OAL) setting where an agent operates over a stream of observations...

name.justification: The paper proposes to use the Partial Monitoring framework as a basis for OAL tasks, introducing new methodologies within that context.
name.quote: We propose a novel foundation for OAL tasks based on partial monitoring, a theoretical framework specialized in online learning from partially informative actions.

name.justification: The study introduces cost-sensitive online active learning tasks as a component of the research.
name.quote: We expand the real-world potential of OAL by introducing a new class of cost-sensitive OAL tasks.

name.justification: NeuralCBP is directly introduced and developed in the paper as a contribution to address OAL tasks using neural networks.
name.quote: We propose NeuralCBP, the first PM strategy that accounts for predictive uncertainty with deep neural networks.

is_contributed.justification: NeuralCBP is a contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We propose NeuralCBP, the first PM strategy...

is_executed.justification: There is no explicit mention of whether neural network execution details (e.g., on GPU) are provided for NeuralCBP in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Our extensive empirical evaluation on open source datasets shows that NeuralCBP is competitive...

is_compared.justification: The paper compares NeuralCBP with existing state-of-the-art methodologies over different benchmarks.
is_compared.quote: Our empirical evaluation shows that NeuralCBP competes with, and even outperforms the current state-of-the-art...

referenced_paper_title.value: An adaptive algorithm for finite stochastic partial monitoring
referenced_paper_title.justification: This related paper provides foundational information on partial monitoring strategies, which are built upon in developing NeuralCBP.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Existing PM strategies are limited to the linear [Heuillet et al., 2024] and logistic [Bart√≥k et al., 2012a], which constitute a bottleneck towards the adoption of PM in practice.
